member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeKernel.GetWorkGroupSize(Cloo.ComputeDevice)
member.summary: The maximum work-group size that can be used to execute the kernel on the specified device.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeKernel.SetArgument(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets the value of a specific argument of the kernel.
member.param: The argument index. Arguments to the kernel are referred by indices that go from 0 for the leftmost argument to n - 1, where n is the total number of arguments declared by a kernel.
Specifies the size of the argument value in bytes.
A pointer to data that should be used as the argument value for argument specified by index.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeKernel.SetMemoryArgument(System.Int32,Cloo.ComputeMemory)
member.summary: Set the argument value for a specific argument of a kernel.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeKernel.SetMemoryArgument(System.Int32,Cloo.ComputeMemory,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the argument value for a specific argument of a kernel.
member.param: The argument index. Arguments to the kernel are referred by indices that go from 0 for the leftmost argument to n - 1, where n is the total number of arguments declared by a kernel.
The memory object that is passed as the argument to the kernel.
Specify whether the kernel should prevent garbage collection of this memory object before kernel execution. This is useful if the application code doesn't refer to this memory object after this call.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeKernel.SetSamplerArgument(System.Int32,Cloo.ComputeSampler)
member.summary: Sets the specified kernel argument.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeKernel.SetSamplerArgument(System.Int32,Cloo.ComputeSampler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the argument value for a specific argument of a kernel.
member.param: The argument index. Arguments to the kernel are referred by indices that go from 0 for the leftmost argument to n - 1, where n is the total number of arguments declared by a kernel.
The sampler object that is passed as the argument to the kernel.

Specify whether the kernel should prevent garbage collection of this sampler object before kernel execution. This is useful if the application code doesn't refer to this sampler object after this call.

member.summary: Creates a new ComputeImageFormat.
member.param: Specifies the number of channels and the channel layout i.e. the memory layout in which channels are stored in the image.
Describes the type of the channel data. The number of bits per element determined by the channelType and channelOrder must be a power of two.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeImageFormat.ChannelOrder
member.summary: Gets the number of channels and the channel layout i.e. the memory layout in which channels are stored in the image.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeImageFormat.ChannelType
member.summary: Gets the type of the channel data.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeDevice.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.AddressBits
member.summary: The default compute device address space size specified as an unsigned integer value in bits. Currently supported values are 32 or 64 bits.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Available
member.summary: Is true if the device is available and false if the device is not available.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.CompilerAvailable
member.summary: Is false if the implementation does not have a compiler available to compile the program source. Is true if the compiler is available. This can be false for the embededed platform profile only.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.DriverVersion
member.summary: OpenCL software driver version string in the form major_number.minor_number.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.EndianLittle
member.summary: Is true if the OpenCL device is a little endian device and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.ErrorCorrectionSupport
member.summary: Is true if the device implements error correction for the memories, caches, registers etc. in the device. Is false if the device does not implement error correction. This can be a requirement for certain clients of OpenCL.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.ExecutionCapabilities
member.summary: Describes the execution capabilities of the device. This is a bit-field that describes one or more of the following values: ExecKernel - The OpenCL device can execute OpenCL kernels. ExecNativeKernel - The OpenCL device can execute native kernels. The mandated minimum capability is ExecKernel.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Extensions
member.summary: Returns a collection of extension names.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.GlobalMemoryCacheLineSize
member.summary: Size of global memory cache line in bytes.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.GlobalMemoryCacheSize
member.summary: Size of global memory cache in bytes.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.GlobalMemoryCacheType
member.summary: Type of global memory cache supported. Valid values are: None, ReadOnlyCache and ReadWriteCache.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.GlobalMemorySize
member.summary: Size of global device memory in bytes.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Image2DMaxHeight
member.summary: Max height of 2D image in pixels. The minimum value is 8192 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Image2DMaxWidth
member.summary: Max width of 2D image in pixels. The minimum value is 8192 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Image3DMaxDepth
member.summary: Max depth of 3D image in pixels. The minimum value is 2048 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Image3DMaxHeight
member.summary: Max height of 3D image in pixels. The minimum value is 2048 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Image3DMaxWidth
member.summary: Max width of 3D image in pixels. The minimum value is 2048 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.ImageSupport
member.summary: Is true if images are supported by the OpenCL device and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.LocalMemorySize
member.summary: Size of local memory arena in bytes. The minimum value is 16 KB.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.LocalMemoryType
member.summary: Type of local memory supported. This can be set to Local implying dedicated local memory storage such as SRAM, or Global.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxClockFrequency
member.summary: Maximum configured clock frequency of the device in MHz.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxComputeUnits
member.summary: The number of parallel compute cores on the OpenCL device. The minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxConstantArguments
member.summary: Max number of arguments declared with the __constant qualifier in a kernel. The minimum value is 8.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxConstantBufferSize
member.summary: Max size in bytes of a constant buffer allocation. The minimum value is 64 KB.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxMemoryAllocationSize
member.summary: Max size of memory object allocation in bytes. The minimum value is max(GlobalMemorySize/4, 128*1024*1024).

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxParameterSize
member.summary: Max size in bytes of the arguments that can be passed to a kernel. The minimum value is 256.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxReadImageArguments
member.summary: Max number of simultaneous image objects that can be read by a kernel. The minimum value is 128 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxSamplers
member.summary: Maximum number of samplers that can be used in a kernel. The minimum value is 16 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxWorkGroupSize
member.summary: Maximum number of work-items in a work-group executing a kernel using the data parallel execution model. The minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxWorkItemDimensions
member.summary: Maximum dimensions that specify the global and local work-item IDs used by the data parallel execution model. The minimum value is 3.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxWorkItemSizes
member.summary: Maximum number of work-items that can be specified in each dimension of the globalWorkSize to ComputeCommandQueue.Execute(...).

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MaxWriteImageArguments
member.summary: Max number of simultaneous image objects that can be written to by a kernel. The minimum value is 8 if ImageSupport is true.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MemoryBaseAddressAlignment
member.summary: Describes the alignment in bits of the base address of any allocated memory object.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.MinDataTypeAlignmentSize
member.summary: The smallest alignment in bytes which can be used for any data type.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Name
member.summary: Device name string.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Platform
member.summary: The platform associated with this device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.PreferredVectorWidthDouble
member.summary: Preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors. The vector width is defined as the number of scalar elements that can be stored in the vector.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.PreferredVectorWidthFloat
member.summary: Preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors. The vector width is defined as the number of scalar elements that can be stored in the vector.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.PreferredVectorWidthChar
member.summary: Preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors. The vector width is defined as the number of scalar elements that can be stored in the vector.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.PreferredVectorWidthInt
member.summary: Preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors. The vector width is defined as the number of scalar elements that can be stored in the vector.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.PreferredVectorWidthLong
member.summary: Preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors. The vector width is defined as the number of scalar elements that can be stored in the vector.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.PreferredVectorWidthShort
member.summary: Preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors. The vector width is defined as the number of scalar elements that can be stored in the vector.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Profile
member.summary: OpenCL profile string. Returns the profile name supported by the device (see note). The profile name returned can be one of the following strings: FULL_PROFILE - if the device supports the OpenCL specification (functionality defined as part of the core specification and does not require any extensions to be supported). EMBEDDED_PROFILE - if the device supports the OpenCL embedded profile.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.ProfilingTimerResolution
member.summary: Describes the resolution of device timer. This is measured in nanoseconds.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.ComputeCommandQueueFlags
member.summary: Describes the command-queue properties supported by the device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.SingleCapabilites
member.summary: Describes single precision floating-point capability of the device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Type
member.summary: The OpenCL device type. Currently supported values are one of or a combination of: Cpu, Gpu, Accelerator, or Default.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Vendor
member.summary: Vendor name string.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.VendorId
member.summary: A unique device vendor identifier. An example of a unique device identifier could be the PCIe ID.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeDevice.Version
member.summary: OpenCL version string. Returns the OpenCL version supported by the device. This version string has the following format: OpenCL[space][major_version.minor_version][space][vendor-specific information]

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContext.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeDevice},Cloo.ComputeContextPropertyList,Cloo.ComputeContextNotifier,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates an OpenCL context with one or more associated devices.
member.param: A list of devices to associate with this context.
A descriptor of this context properties.

A callback function that can be registered by the application. This callback function will be used by the OpenCL implementation to report information on errors that occur in this context. This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe. If notify is null, no callback function is registered.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContext.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeDeviceTypes,Cloo.ComputeContextPropertyList,Cloo.ComputeContextNotifier,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates an OpenCL context from a device type that identifies the specific device(s) to use.
member.param: A bit-field that identifies the Type of device to associate with this context.
A descriptor of this context properties.

A callback function that can be registered by the application. This callback function will be used by the OpenCL implementation to report information on errors that occur in this context. This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe. If notify is null, no callback function is registered.
Passed as the userDataPtr argument when notify is called. userDataPtr can be IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContext.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this context.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeContext.Devices
member.summary: The devices associated with this context.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeContext.Platform
member.summary: The platform associated with this context.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeContext.Properties
member.summary: The properties of the context as specified on context creation.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeContextNotifier
member.summary: A callback function that can be registered by the application. This callback function will be used by the OpenCL implementation to report information on errors that occur in this context. This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.
member.param: An error string.
A pointer to binary data that is returned by the OpenCL implementation that can be used to log additional information helpful in debugging the error.
The size of the binary data that is returned by the OpenCL.
A pointer to user supplied data.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeBuffer`1.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,Cloo.ComputeMemoryFlags,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a new buffer object.
member.param: A valid OpenCL context used to create this buffer.
A bit-field that is used to specify allocation and usage information such as the memory area that should be used to allocate the buffer and how it will be used.
The number of elements this buffer will contain.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeBuffer`1.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,Cloo.ComputeMemoryFlags,System.Int64,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new buffer object.
member.param: A valid OpenCL context used to create this buffer.
A bit-field that is used to specify allocation and usage information such as the memory area that should be used to allocate the buffer and how it will be used.
The number of elements this buffer will contain.
A pointer to the data this buffer will contain.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeBuffer`1.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,Cloo.ComputeMemoryFlags,`0[])
member.summary: Creates a new buffer object.
member.param: A valid OpenCL context used to create this buffer.
A bit-field that is used to specify allocation and usage information such as the memory area that should be used to allocate the buffer and how it will be used.
The elements this buffer will contain.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeBuffer`1.CreateFromGLBuffer``1(Cloo.ComputeContext,Cloo.ComputeMemoryFlags,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new buffer from an existing OpenGL buffer.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of this buffer.
member.param: A compute context with enabled CL/GL sharing.
A bit field that is used to specify allocation and usage information.
The OpenGL buffer object to create this buffer from.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeBuffer`1.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this buffer.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeBuffer`1.Count
member.summary: The number of items this buffer contains.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCompiler.Unload
member.summary: Unloads the OpenCL compiler.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeException.ThrowOnError(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks for an error and throws an exception if such is encountered.
member.param: The value to be checked for an OpenCL error.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeException.ThrowOnError(Cloo.ComputeErrorCode)
member.summary: Checks for an error and throws an exception if such is encountered.
member.param: The value to be checked for an OpenCL error.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a program for a context, using the source code specified. The devices associated with the program are the devices associated with context.
member.param: A valid OpenCL context.
The source code for this program.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a program for a context, using the source code specified. The devices associated with the program are the devices associated with context.
member.param: A valid OpenCL context.
The source code for this program.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Byte[]},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Cloo.ComputeDevice})
member.summary: Creates a program for a context, using the binaries specified.
member.param: A valid OpenCL context.
The binaries to be assigned to the devices.
A subset of the devices associated with the context or null for all the devices associated with the context.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Build(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeDevice},System.String,Cloo.ComputeProgramBuildNotifier,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Builds (compiles and links) a program executable from the program source or binary for all the devices or some specific devices in the OpenCL context associated with program.
member.param: A list of devices associated with program. If the list is null, the program executable is built for all devices associated with program for which a source or a binary has been loaded.
A set of options for the OpenCL compiler.

A notification routine. The notification routine is a callback function that an application can register and which will be called when the program executable has been built (successfully or unsuccessfully). If notify is not null, ComputeProgram.Build does not need to wait for the build to complete and can return immediately. If notify is null, ComputeProgram.Build does not return until the build has completed. This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.
Passed as an argument when notify is called. notifyDataPtr can be IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.CreateAllKernels
member.summary: Creates kernel objects for all kernel functions in program. Kernel objects are not created for any __kernel functions in program that do not have the same function definition across all devices for which a program executable has been successfully built.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.CreateKernel(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a kernel object for the kernel function specified by the function name.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.GetBuildLog(Cloo.ComputeDevice)
member.summary: Gets the build log of program for the specified device.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.GetBuildStatus(Cloo.ComputeDevice)
member.summary: Gets the build status of program for the specified device.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this program.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Binaries
member.summary: Return the program binaries for all devices associated with program. he bits returned can be an implementation-specific intermediate representation (a.k.a. IR) or device specific executable bits or both. The decision on which information is returned in the binary is up to the OpenCL implementation.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeProgram.BuildOptions
member.summary: Return the build options specified by the options argument when the program is created.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Context
member.summary: Return the context specified when the program object is created

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Devices
member.summary: Return the list of devices associated with the program object. This can be the devices associated with context on which the program object has been created or can be a subset of devices that are specified when a progam object is created from binaries.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Source
member.summary: Return the program source code specified when creating the program. null if program was created from binaries.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContextPropertyList.#ctor(Cloo.ComputePlatform)
member.summary: Creates a new property list.
member.param: A platform property for this list. Can be null.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContextPropertyList.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Cloo.ComputeContextProperty})
member.summary: Creates a new property list.
member.param: A collection of ComputeContextProperty items.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,Cloo.ComputeDevice,Cloo.ComputeCommandQueueFlags)
member.summary: Creates a new command-queue.
member.param: Must be a valid OpenCL context.
Must be a device associated with context. It can either be in the list of devices or have the same Type as the device specified when the contex is created.
A list of properties for the command-queue.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.AcquireGLObjects(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeMemory},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeEvent})
member.summary: Acquire OpenCL memory objects that have been created from OpenGL objects.
member.param: A list of CL memory objects that correspond to GL objects.
Specify events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If events is not null a new event identifying this command is attached to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.AddBarrier
member.summary: Enqueues a barrier. This barrier ensures that all queued commands have finished execution before the next batch of commands can begin execution.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.AddMarker
member.summary: Enqueues a marker.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Copy``1(Cloo.ComputeBuffer{``0},Cloo.ComputeBuffer{``0},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeEvent})
member.summary: Enqueues a command to copy data between buffers.
member.param: The buffer to copy from.
The buffer to copy to.
Specify events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If events is not null a new event identifying this command is attached to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.ExecuteTask(Cloo.ComputeKernel,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeEvent})
member.summary: Enqueues a command to execute a single kernel.
member.param: The kernel to execute.
Specify events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If events is not null a new event identifying this command is attached to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Execute(Cloo.ComputeKernel,System.Int64[],System.Int64[],System.Int64[],System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeEvent})
member.summary: Enqueues a command to execute a range of kernels.
member.param: The kernel to execute.
Can be used to specify an array of values that describe the offset used to calculate the global ID of a work-item instead of having the global IDs always start at offset (0, 0,... 0).

An array of values that describe the number of global work-items in dimensions that will execute the kernel function. The total number of global work-items is computed as global_work_size[0] *...* global_work_size[work_dim - 1].

An array of values that describe the number of work-items that make up a work-group (also referred to as the size of the work-group) that will execute the kernel specified by kernel. The total number of work-items in a work-group is computed as local_work_size[0] *... * local_work_size[work_dim - 1].
Specify events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If events is not null a new event identifying this command is attached to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Finish
member.summary: Blocks until all previously queued OpenCL commands in this queue are issued to the associated device and have completed.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Flush
member.summary: Issues all previously queued OpenCL commands in this queue to the associated device. This method only guarantees that all queued commands get issued to the appropriate device. There is no guarantee that they will be complete after this method returns.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Read(Cloo.ComputeImage,System.Boolean,System.Int64[],System.Int64[],System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IntPtr,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeEvent})
member.summary: Enqueues a command to read data from an image.
member.param: The image to read from.
Indicates if this operation is blocking or non-blocking.
The (x, y, z) offset in pixels where reading starts.
The region (width, height, depth) in pixels to read.
The length of each row in bytes. This value must be greater than or equal to the pixel size in bytes * width.
Size in bytes of the 2D slice of the 3D region of a 3D image being read. This must be 0 if image is a 2D image. This value must be greater than or equal to rowPitch * height.
A preallocated memory area to read the data into.
Specify events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If events is not null a new event identifying this command is attached to the end of the list.

member.param: A collection of CL memory objects that correspond to GL objects.
Specify events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If events is not null a new event identifying this command is attached to the end of the list.

member.param: The events that will be waited for.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Context
member.summary: Gets the context specified when the command-queue is created.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Device
member.summary: Gets the device specified when the command-queue is created.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.OutOfOrderExecution
member.summary: Gets or sets the execution order of commands in the command-queue.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Profiling
member.summary: Enable or disable profiling of commands in the command-queue.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeEvent.ToString
member.summary: Gets the string representation of this event.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.CommandQueue
member.summary: Return the ComputeCommandQueue associated with event.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.CommandType
member.summary: Return the command type associated with event.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.CommandFinishTime
member.summary: A 64-bit value that describes the current device time counter in nanoseconds when the command identified by event has finished execution on the device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.CommandEnqueueTime
member.summary: A 64-bit value that describes the current device time counter in nanoseconds when the command identified by event is enqueued in a command-queue by the host.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.CommandStartTime
member.summary: A 64-bit value that describes the current device time counter in nanoseconds when the command identified by event starts execution on the device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.CommandSubmitTime
member.summary: A 64-bit value that describes the current device time counter in nanoseconds when the command identified by event that has been enqueued is submitted by the host to the device associated with the command-queue.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEvent.ExecutionStatus
member.summary: Return the execution status of the command identified by event.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContextProperty.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContextPropertyName,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new context property.
member.param: The name of the created property.
The value of the created property.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContextProperty.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this ComputeContextProperty.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeContextProperty.Name
member.summary: The name of this property.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeContextProperty.Value
member.summary: The value of this property.
